```yaml
key_concepts: [abstraction, implementation, decoupling, class-hierarchies, delegation, polymorphism, interface-based-programming]
code_examples: false
difficulty_level: intermediate
summary: |
  [The Bridge design pattern is a structural pattern that separates an abstraction from its implementation, allowing both to evolve independently. It involves two distinct class hierarchies: the Abstraction, which defines the high-level interface, and the Implementation, which provides the low-level details. The Abstraction maintains a reference to an Implementation object and delegates its operations. This pattern is particularly useful for developing cross-platform applications or integrating with multiple external services, as it promotes flexibility and extensibility by decoupling the client-facing interface from its underlying concrete implementations.]
---
```
